headline: GOP govs offer states as alternative RNC convention host
author: Associated Press
sentences:
By ZEKE MILLER and BEN NADLER
WASHINGTON (AP)  Two GOP governors are offering up their states to host the Republican National Convention  a day after President Donald Trump threatened to pull the convention out of North Carolina if that state's Democratic governor doesn't assure him that the August gathering can go forward despite coronavirus fears.

Plans have been underway for more than a year to hold the convention in Charlotte, but Trump and national Republican officials have expressed concerns that local officials may not allow gatherings of that size during the pandemic.

Brian Kemp sent an open plea to Trump on Tuesday to consider his state as an alternate site for the quadrennial convention, which is set to gather more than 2,500 delegates and thousands more guests, press and security officials.
